summary: When Dumbledore hints that there's a way to save both Sirius and Buckbeak, Hermione reveals the secret she’s kept all year—she’s been using a Time-Turner. For the first time, she fully includes Harry in the truth she’s carried alone, explaining her academic overload and why she’s been so stressed. Her tone is urgent but composed, switching immediately into problem-solving mode. Despite the emotional weight of what’s at stake, she manages to stay rational and focused. This moment marks a shift in trust and leadership—Hermione takes control not just of a secret, but of the mission.
logline: Hermione reveals her greatest secret and steps into a leadership role, guiding Harry through a high-stakes rescue.
speech_style: Quick, focused, and no-nonsense; blends logic with quiet urgency
emotional_state: Determined and serious; finally relieved to share her burden and ready to act
